Section 01

Introduction

Backchain is an unstoppable, permissionless DeFi ecosystem deployed on Arbitrum (Ethereum L2). It is designed from first principles to operate without centralized control: no admin keys, no pause functions, no blacklists. Once deployed, the protocol runs forever.

The $BKC token is not a speculative afterthought — it is a real utility token from day zero. It serves as fuel, collateral, and reward across every module in the ecosystem.

The architecture comprises 16 smart contracts working together in a hub & spoke model, where the BackchainEcosystem contract acts as the central orchestrator connecting all peripheral modules: staking, trading, NFTs, gaming, social, governance, and more.

Philosophy: Code is law. Every rule is enforced on-chain, every fee split is immutable, and every interaction is permissionless. There is no off-switch.

Section 04

The pStake System (Time-Weighted Stake Power)

In the Backchain staking system, your share of rewards is not determined solely by how many tokens you stake — it is determined by your pStake (power-stake), a time-weighted metric that rewards long-term commitment.

pStake = amount × (10000 + lockDays × 5918 / 365) / 10000

The lock period ranges from 1 day to 3,650 days (10 years). Longer locks produce a higher pStake multiplier, granting a proportionally larger share of the reward pool.

Lock Period Multiplier pStake for 10,000 BKC
1 day 1.0002x 10,016
30 days 1.0486x 10,486
365 days 1.5918x 15,918
1,825 days (5y) 3.9590x 39,590
3,650 days (10y) 6.9180x 69,180

Circulation scarcity: Staked tokens are locked and removed from circulating supply for the chosen period. A 10-year lock produces nearly 7x the reward power of an unlocked stake — creating a powerful incentive to reduce circulating supply.

Section 05

Proof-of-Purchase Mining (BuybackMiner)

Unlike proof-of-work or proof-of-stake, Backchain introduces Proof-of-Purchase Mining — a novel emission model where new BKC tokens are minted only when real economic activity occurs on the platform.

How It Works

  1. Users interact with the protocol (buying NFT Boosters, trading, renting, etc.)
  2. ETH fees generated by these actions flow to the BuybackMiner contract
  3. The BuybackMiner converts ETH into newly minted BKC via a scarcity curve
  4. The more BKC that has been mined, the harder (more expensive) it becomes to mint the next unit — analogous to Bitcoin’s halvings

Distribution of Mined BKC

Destination Share Purpose
Stakers 70% Distributed proportionally based on pStake
Treasury 30% Funds ongoing protocol development

Hard cap enforced: The BKCToken contract has an immutable maximum supply of 200,000,000 BKC. Once reached, no further minting can occur — ever. The scarcity curve ensures this cap is approached asymptotically, not linearly.

Section 06

Fee System

Every protocol action — buying NFTs, renting boosters, notarizing documents, playing FortunePool — generates a small ETH fee. The BackchainEcosystem contract automatically splits each fee into five channels:

Channel Share Description
Tutor 10% Paid to the user’s referrer. If no tutor is set, this share is burned.
Operator 10–20% Paid to the app builder who routed the transaction. If no operator, this share is burned.
Buyback 30–50% Used to buy and permanently burn BKC from the liquidity pool.
Treasury 10–30% Funds protocol development and ecosystem growth.
Custom varies Module-specific allocation (e.g., FortunePool prize fund, charity pool).

No leaks: If no tutor is registered, the tutor share is burned. If no operator is passed, the operator share is burned. ETH never sits idle — it either rewards participants or reduces supply. All fee splits are immutable on-chain.

Section 07

NFT Booster System

The RewardBooster NFTs are ERC-721 tokens that directly reduce the burn rate applied when claiming staking rewards. Without an NFT, up to 50% of your rewards are burned on claim. With a Diamond NFT, you keep nearly 100%.

NFT Trading (Bonding Curves)

Each tier has its own NFTPool contract implementing a bonding curve. The price of each NFT is determined algorithmically by supply and demand — buy low when supply is high, sell high when supply is low. No order books, no counterparty risk.

NFT Fusion

The NFTFusion contract enables tier upgrades and downgrades:

  • Fuse: Combine 2 same-tier NFTs into 1 higher-tier NFT
  • Split: Break 1 NFT into 2 lower-tier NFTs
  • SplitTo: Cascade split 1 NFT down to a target tier (1 becomes 2N)

NFT Rental (AirBNFT)

The RentalManager contract enables a trustless NFT rental marketplace. Booster owners can list their NFTs for rent, and stakers can temporarily access boost power without purchasing. Rental fees generate ETH that flows through the same fee system.

Section 08

Scarcity Engines

Backchain employs five complementary mechanisms that continuously reduce supply and increase the cost of acquiring new tokens:

1

Emission Scarcity

The BuybackMiner's scarcity curve makes each successive BKC exponentially more expensive to mint. Early participants benefit from lower costs.

2

Circulation Scarcity

The pStake system locks tokens for up to 10 years, physically removing them from circulating supply and reducing sell pressure.

3

Fee Scarcity (Buyback & Burn)

30–50% of every ETH fee is used to buy BKC from the liquidity pool and permanently burn it, reducing total supply over time.

4

Burn-on-Claim

Claiming staking rewards without an NFT Booster burns up to 50% of the claim. This creates demand for NFTs and further reduces circulating supply.

5

No-Participant Burns

When a user has no tutor or no operator is specified, those fee shares are burned instead of accumulated. Every unclaimed referral is a permanent supply reduction.

Section 09

Growth Programs

Tutor System (Referrals)

Every user can invite friends by sharing their wallet address as a referral link. Once a new user registers with a tutor, the tutor earns:

  • 10% of their student's ETH fees — every action the student takes, the tutor earns
  • 5% of their student's BKC claims — staking rewards, mining rewards, forever

The tutor relationship is permanent and on-chain. It includes gasless onboarding for first-time users, removing the friction of needing ETH for gas before interacting with the protocol.

Operator System (Builder Incentives)

Any developer can build a frontend, bot, or integration for Backchain and pass their wallet address as the operator parameter in transactions. This earns them 10–20% of every ETH fee generated through their application.

Permissionless: No registration, no approval, no API key. Just pass your address. The smart contract handles everything. This turns every builder into a stakeholder.

Fair Launch Principles

100%
Self-Funded

Backchain was built over 10,000+ hours of development with zero external funding. There are no team token allocations, no investor vesting schedules, and no venture capital involvement.

The founding team earns the same way the community does — by using the protocol. They stake, they trade, they earn rewards through the same mechanisms available to every participant. This alignment of incentives ensures that protocol improvements benefit everyone equally.

Skin in the game: With no pre-allocated tokens, the team’s economic success is directly tied to building a protocol people actually want to use. There is no “dump and run” scenario — only long-term alignment.
